result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wallace L Shilkus in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Wallace L Shilkus.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney requesting trial dates for a 2 day jury trial. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wallace L Shilkus in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Wallace L Shilkus.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lochowicz is requesting an adjournment. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wallace L Shilkus in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Wallace L Shilkus. Defense has received offer from the District Attorneys Office. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Wallace L Shilkus in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Wallace L Shilkus. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Defendant advised of rights to & waived PH. Information will mirror complaint. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Wallace L Shilkus in court. Attorney Bradley Lochowicz appeared for Defendant in court. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin. State needs more time, Defense not objecting. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): D.J.C. dob 2-11-1962. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1983
